comments:
Have sent details to Peter, and had a discussion with him.  This is the stacktrace:

org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Invalid thread access
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2942)
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2865)
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2836)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.error(Widget.java:395)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Shell.<init>(Shell.java:246)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Shell.<init>(Shell.java:237)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Shell.<init>(Shell.java:190)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Shell.<init>(Shell.java:128)
	at org.eclipse.wst.command.internal.env.ui.eclipse.EclipseStatusHandler.<init>(EclipseStatusHandler.java:33)
	at org.eclipse.wst.command.internal.env.ui.eclipse.SWTEnvironmentManager.getNewSWTEnvironment(SWTEnvironmentManager.java:23)
	at com.ibm.ast.ws.ui.WSUIEnvironmentAdapter.getDefaultEnvironment(WSUIEnvironmentAdapter.java:53)
Is this occuring due to a call into the StatusHandler from a thread that is different from the primary display thread? If so, we'll need to detect this and use asyncExec or something like it.

Created an attachment (id=30725)
Wst command env ui plugin patch

Hi Kathy, this patch for this defect is ready to be committed.  Kelvin has tested that it resolves the issue he was seeing.  This patch also contains the fix for defect 117074, since both fixes were in the same plugin.  Thanks.
Committed. Thanks. Will release later today.
